title: Brierley Forest Park Walking Route

images.title: Alan Heardman / Brierley Forest Park - Footpath
images.caption: A nice view of a footpath at the entrance to the reserve. Also shown in this picture is the information board.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Brierley Forest Park - Footpath
images.caption: The picture shows two sections of pit winding wheels marking the footpath.

images.title: Ann Ballinger [CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)]
images.caption: Interesting miner sculptures at Brierley Forest Country Park. These figures stand near the Visitor Centre at Brierley Forest Country Park. The park is on the site of the former Sutton Colliery but which was called Brierley as many of the original miners came from Brierley in Staffordshire.

images.title: Alan Heardman / View from dismantled railway track next to Brierley Forest Park
images.caption: View from dismantled railway track next to Brierley Forest Park. In the very far distance Silverhill Country Park can just be seen.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Brierley Forest Park - Visitor Centre
images.caption: Visitor Centre

images.title: Alan Heardman / View across Golf Course next to Brierley Forest Park
images.caption: View across Golf Course next to the park.

description: This circular walk takes you around the pretty Brierley Forest Park near Mansfield.  At the park you will find Wildflower meadows, a sculpture trail and a visitor centre. Look out for foxes, owls, deer, meadow pipits and lapwings as you make your way through the park. There's also bridleways and paths that are suitable for cycling in some parts of the park.
